citations.desc: Cleaning, sanitization, housekeeping, and pest control.
citations.narrative:
An excessive amount of fecal material was observed in the litter boxes of six cat enclosures. Litter boxes are not being
cleaned daily to prevent excessive buildup.
It is important for daily removal of excreta for the comfort of the animal, prevent soiling of the animal, and to reduce
disease hazards, insects, pests and odors.
Excreta must be removed from primary enclosures daily, and as often as necessary to prevent excessive buildup of fecal
material. Correct this day, 10DEC2025, forward.

There is an accumulation of more than a day’s worth of feces along the bottom edges of an enclosure housing 4 Ring-
tailed lemurs.
Not maintaining appropriate levels of cleanliness and allowing feces to buildup in areas where nonhuman primates can
come in contact can result in soiling of animal, risk of disease, and attraction of unwanted pests and odors.
Hard surfaces with which nonhuman primates come in contact must be spot cleaned daily to prevent buildup of feces and
spoiled food matter. Correct this day, 10DEC2025, forward.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representatives.
n

narrative:
3.11(a) 
   
Cleaning, sanitization, housekeeping, and pest control. 
An excessive amount of fecal material was observed in the litter boxes of six cat enclosures. Litter boxes are not being 
cleaned daily to prevent excessive buildup.  
It is important for daily removal of excreta for the comfort of the animal, prevent soiling of the animal, and to reduce 
disease hazards, insects, pests and odors. 
Excreta must be removed from primary enclosures daily, and as often as necessary to prevent excessive buildup of fecal 
material. Correct this day, 10DEC2025, forward. 
3.75(c)(3) 
   
Housing facilities, general. 
There is an accumulation of more than a day’s worth of feces along the bottom edges of an enclosure housing 4 Ring-
tailed lemurs. 
Not maintaining appropriate levels of cleanliness and allowing feces to buildup in areas where nonhuman primates can 
come in contact can result in soiling of animal, risk of disease, and attraction of unwanted pests and odors. 
Hard surfaces with which nonhuman primates come in contact must be spot cleaned daily to prevent buildup of feces and 
spoiled food matter. Correct this day, 10DEC2025, forward. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representatives. 
 
 n
